title: Merge k Sorted Lists
description:
You are given an array of k linked lists, each sorted in ascending order. Merge all the linked lists into one sorted linked list and return it.

Example:
  Input: lists = [[1,4,5],[1,3,4],[2,6]]
  Output: [1,1,2,3,4,4,5,6]

Constraints:
- k == lists.length
- 0 <= k <= 10000
- 0 <= lists[i].length <= 500
- -10000 <= lists[i][j] <= 10000
- lists[i] is sorted in ascending order
- The sum of lists[i].length will not exceed 10000
test_code:
require 'minitest/autorun'
require_relative 'solution'

def to_linked(arr)
  head = nil
  arr.reverse.each { |v| head = ListNode.new(v, head) }
  head
end

def to_array(head)
  result = []
  while head
    result << head.val
    head = head.next_node
  end
  result
end

class TestMergeKSortedLists < Minitest::Test
  def test_basic
    lists = [[1,4,5],[1,3,4],[2,6]].map { |a| to_linked(a) }
    assert_equal [1,1,2,3,4,4,5,6], to_array(merge_k_lists(lists))
  end
  def test_empty_array
    assert_nil merge_k_lists([])
  end
  def test_single_nil
    assert_nil merge_k_lists([nil])
  end
  def test_single_list
    assert_equal [1,2,3], to_array(merge_k_lists([to_linked([1,2,3])]))
  end
end
